critique: This document primarily focuses on maintaining neutrality during wartime, outlining the responsibilities of various government departments in enforcing this neutrality. It doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, or social inclusion. The executive power aspect is neutral, as it simply delegates existing duties. Federalism is also neutral, as it doesn't shift power between state and federal governments. The document leans slightly towards national security, as it prioritizes enforcing neutrality during wartime. Economic regulation is not directly addressed.
